channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Seriously overgrown trees along path., 7th August
item.description:
A large number of trees are very overgrown all along the path which is causing problems with the amount of people walking/running/cycling in both directions. Visibility is reduced which is a possible hazard when bikes are coming in both directions. The overgrown bushes start from Enderby House & all the way up to the dockyard corner (which is a blind corner & have seen multiple bike crashes there).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Out side communal bin cupboard, 7th August
item.description:
The neighbour had put a dirty bin bag in the cupboard thats the bin men didn't collect and thats now crawling with maggots, the bags been removed but the maggots are all up the neighbours door and thousands in the bin cupboard and on the walk way of the block. My mothers disabled so is unable to do anymore than whats she's already done (remove bags ect) this needs addressing immediately. Also the neighbours aint nice so we cannot even knock there for help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clothes Bags dumped on path, 7th August
item.description:
Bags of clothing have been dumped along the small path & have been there for several weeks now. Please can these be cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Lane, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 7th August
item.description:
Please fix the light outside no. 124 as it's not been working for at least 2 weeks now, walking on the pavement is so dangerous as you can't see anything.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Wickham Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large sofa dumped and left months ago, 7th August
item.description:
A big ugly old sofa has been dumped and left. This attracts other litter to be left, attracts foxes etc. It is a complete eyesore to us who live in full view of it. Every time I arrive home I see it. It could have been dumped by the new residents in the house closest to it, in Highland Road as they are undergoing a huge renovation and have lots of rubbish in front of their house and various skips coming and going It arrived at the same time they did, and all the work started but I have no proof

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warren Close, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large flytip hidden in the trees. Unbelievable., 7th August
item.description:
Saw this large flytip earlier in Rockliffe Gardens - on the 3rd level/step down. Also, really bad smell and broken glass, plus a suitcase behind the beds.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brickfield Cottages, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal squatters, 7th August
item.description:
Illegal squatters in a private building. Lots of antisocial behaviour (drug use, fires, loud parties), very aggressive when approached. Dangerous dogs.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elsdale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
